title: The Bachelor's Abbie Chatfield accuses Rachael Arahill and Vakoo Kauapirura of FAKING romance
text:
The Bachelor's Abbie Chatfield has accused co-stars Rachael Arahill and Vakoo Kauapirura of faking their same-sex relationship.

Speaking to the Outspoken podcast on Wednesday, the 24-year-old said: 'To be honest, it could be a bit of gay-baiting and it doesn't sit well with me'.

In August, Rachael and Vakoo, both 23, were photographed kissing in Sydney, and admitted they had started dating since being booted from the dating show.

'Queerbaiting doesn't sit will with me': The Bachelor's Abbie Chatfield (pictured) has accused co-stars Rachael Arahill and Vakoo Kauapirura of faking their same-sex relationship

When first asked about the surprising romance, Abbie said: 'I question the validity of that. Yeah, I don't think that is legit, as far as I know.'

She continued: 'It is just queerbaiting. It illegitimizes same-sex relationships that do come out of The Bachelor. It makes me feel a bit icky.

'It could be legit, they haven't told me it's not. As far as I'm aware, I don't think it is.'

Romance! In August, Rachael (R) and Vakoo (L), both 23, were photographed kissing in Sydney, and admitted they had started dating since being booted from the dating show

Accusing! 'It is just queerbaiting. It illegitimizes same-sex relationships that do come out of The Bachelor. It makes me feel a bit icky,' said Abbie, adding that it 'could be legit' though

Hitting back at Abbie's remarks, Rachael told Daily Mail Australia on Saturday that they are not in contact and the finalist has no knowledge of their relationship.

'We haven't told her its legit because we don't speak to her,' said Rachael.

'I have her blocked... she's the last person I would want to hear from that was part of the show. I hope she doesn't feel the need to comment on my life again.'

Outspoken! Hitting back at Abbie's remarks, Rachael (R) told Daily Mail Australia on Saturday that they are not in contact and Abbie has no knowledge of their relationship

'We haven't told her its legit because we don't speak to her. I have her blocked' said Rachael

Discussing her Bachelor journey on the podcast, Abbie added: 'I had no idea [I'd be cast as the villain].

'It's so funny, because they put Chelsie [McLeod, winner] and I as opposites. Like, she was an angel and I was this devil w**** - but we were really good friends.

'By the end, Helena [Sauzier], Chelsie and I were the closest trio. I thought my edit was going to be that I was a "sook" - I cried every single day and in single interview.

'I was so emotionally exhausted.'
description: The Bachelor's Abbie Chatfield has accused co-stars Rachael Arahill and Vakoo Kauapirura of faking their same-sex relationship.
authors: Joshua Fox For Daily Mail Australia
